title: Ghana: Health Minister Appeals to Striking Doctors to Return to Post
text:
Nigeria: Trial of Treasury Looters Begins in Weeks - Buhari 
He explained that legally, it was the Fair Wages and Salaries Commission (FWSC) that dealt with benefits and salaries for public sector workers on behalf of government, adding that there was a joint committee in charge of the Single Spine Salary Structure (SSSS) which had been meeting to ensure that all public sector workers were successfully migrated unto the scheme. 
He said SSSS started with job evaluation and that it was decided that certain allowances in category two and three of the benefits would be given to all public sector workers after every sector had been migrated unto the scheme. 
Currently, he said, the Joint Committee was meeting with all the Workers Unions to agree on the benefits to be given to all public sector workers, and that if any of the unions had an issue after the negotiations, they would have to channel it through the Labour Commission. 
At the Ridge Hospital, it was realised that the main Out Patients Department was empty but that management had put in place a special arrangement to cater for pregnant women and children. 
The situation at the La General Hospital was not different as management only treated old cases at the Medical and the Labour Wards. 
Ledzokuku-Krowor Municipal Assembly (LEKMA) Hospital at Teshie was the final point of call, where there had been no casualties since the strike action began, according to the management of the hospital, who explained that there had been no new cases because the public thought that doctors would not be available and, therefore, preferred the private hospitals-- the 37 Military and Police Hospital. 
Mr Segbefia commended management of all three Hospitals visited for the effort they were making to treat some patients and urged the doctors to resume work. 
Source: ISD (Doris Sodjah)
